links_reviews_text: I ordered a size up based on reviews and it just looked too sloppy. Just not that great.

links_reviews_title: Very cute but small in the waist
links_reviews_text: I had hoped this would work but it didn’t. That said, it was super cute and I may try it in a medium.

links_reviews_title: Great skirt for a warm vacation
links_reviews_text: The pattern and cut of this skirt is gorgeous! It sits quite high-waisted on me, but I liked that. Though I liked where it fit, I think it runs on the small side - it was definitely snug, and didn't leave too much wiggle room; the waist isn't stretchy at all. My friends thought I should keep this one!

This skirt was too cute. If I was to rent it again I would rent a Small instead of an X Small. The skirt fit and I was able to wear it on my vacation but there was no give at all in the waste line which made it tight when sitting.
Very beautiful skirt. High slit. Very thin and airy.
Never wore it. Runs small!
Size up! The waist is small and unforgiving (no stretch). I also wasn’t in love with the fabric.

Love this skirt but wish I had sized up. No elastic in the waist and it’s very tight. Too much so to be wearable. The rest of the skirt fit perfect through the hips though. If only the waist had some give to it, it would be perfect. Super cute otherwise!
Cute skirt. I ordered it a size (or 2) too small. It was tight in the waist. But I would have loved wearing it if it had fit.
It's a cute skirt, but runs very small. I could not even close the zipper. Order 1 to 2 sizes up.
I love this skirt! It is cut just right- easy to walk in and flowy- felt so pretty! I wore it to a family party but also wore it just to walk around town.

links_reviews_title: Wanted to love, but too big
links_reviews_text: The pattern of this skirt is beautiful, but I read the other reviews saying to size up and unfortunately found the waist entirely too large to wear. I am a true size S and went with a M which caused the waist of the skirt to drop around my hips. I prefer a high-waisted fit, so with the skirt being over sized on me, it just wasn't flattering.

The skirt was very pretty and lightweight - perfect for summer! That being said, I like wearing skirts higher up on my waist so this ended up being a bit too loose for me, unfortunately. I did feel though that if I sized down, it would have been too tight so this isn't ideal if you're someone who can fall in between sizes. As far as styling goes, I paired it with a black bodysuit and wedges when trying it on (exactly how the model is styled) and it worked perfectly.
This is a lovely skirt, but I would suggest to either size up, or order it in 2 sizes to be sure.

The fabric and texture of this skirt is perfect - such a great quality! That said, the waist is SUPER snug. Be sure to size up one size (maybe even 2 sizes) for a good fit. I have a fairly small waist and couldn't even zip the zipper up. I will definitely be trying again in a bigger size though, because it is superbly comfortable for the hot summer days we are experiencing.
Bought for California vacation. Stylish and fun.
Wore this for Lunar New Year and it was perfect. Colors of the embroidery really pop.

I loved the details on this top! There are little sequins in the embroidery that you can’t really see in the photos, and they make it even more special. The tassels were really frayed and messy when it arrived and I couldn’t make them look nice so I just tucked them into the shirt and kept them hidden. Not a big deal though. Overall a lovely shirt!

links_reviews_title: Love! Super beautiful, and tons of compliments
links_reviews_text: I loved getting to wear this top! I styled it with overalls, jeans, and and tucked into a skirt. I was worried the white would be see-though, but it was just thick enough to not show my bra. I did notice that the tassels like to unravel, so I was worried they may fray too much and lose all their pink string. I kept re-winding up the string so it wouldn't completely unravel. This probably doesn't happen on all of them, as it only happened to one of the pink tassels on mine.
I am normally an xs and normally do not size up as sometimes even an xs is too big. This blouse is SO cute, but was SO small! I should of gone up to a small or honestly, possibly a medium.
LOVED this top! Fit true to size. Might be tight across the chest for someone with a larger chest. Beautiful details!

This top has such pretty details from the embroidery and the sequin touches, but it runs tiny! I can usually wear XS or S in most brands, but I could barely get the XS on- it was tight across the chest, shoulders, and armpits. I don't know if a small would have fit either. If you are between 2 sizes, definitely choose the bigger one!

This shirt was really cute and so comfortable! I am giving it a 4 star rating because the tassels unraveled during the first hour of wearing it. It was the perfect material for a hot day. It also matches a lot so you can mix up wearing it with jeans or shorts!

I should have listened to the other reviews... there is way too much fabric on this. It "fits" in the places a flowy top should fit - arm holes, neckline, even length bc it's a tunic. But it just has so much fabric it feels silly. It would be a super cute summer maternity top. It's well made and good quality fabric, but just a lot of it
Flirty fit

I was only able to wear this once due to the colder weather. I paired it with a denim jacket and received a ton of compliments. It is long and flowy, so if you are petite you may not like it. Perfect for pregnancy and I wish I was able to wear it more but the weather didn't cooperate.
very boho but really couldn't wear it in cold weather. would be great for summer with shorts or lightweight pants. very oversized could have worn an xxs
It reminded me of a piece of maturity wear. I tend to stay away from pieces like this that have too much fabric. Its not represented well on the model, who makes it look like a slim and chic tunic.

links_reviews_title: Most comfortable tunic and gorgeous details, runs large
links_reviews_text: I was searching for tunic-style tops I could wear over maternity jeans and this was the perfect one. I wore my normal pre-pregnancy size (XS) at 22-26 weeks pregnant and while still a little hangy on top, it was the perfect length. The crochet details are beautiful on this. I would wear over and over again without my bump, but I would like need a petite size or XXS. Pre-pregnancy I was 5’4 108 lbs and am closer to 130 with a bump in the photo.
I love all the detail of this lacey top. My only complaints are that I should've sized down more than one size and the flare at the bottom of the top is a little too much for my hips!

I decided to stick with my normal size Large even though some reviews said it ran large. While there was a lot of fabric, it's lightweight so it flowed fine. It is very sheer, so if you aren't comfortable with that, you may want to wear a cami underneath. I wore this with skinny fit pants and looked very cute with it!

links_reviews_title: Beautiful, Flowy Tank with Killer Details
links_reviews_text: LOVED this top! Rented while 9 months pregnant, and it checked every box - covered the bump (with plenty of fabric to spare), had beautiful detailing, and an excellent drape. The weight of the fabric also gave it a lovely movement, with a great swing for end of summer. Love, love, love!

There's so much to love about this tunic! It's lightweight (so when it's 90+ degrees outside you feel cute AND cool), the detailing is beautiful and it goes with everything! I will note that it is pretty sheer as you can tell by the photo, I personally didn't have an issue with it but it is something to note. Also, I probably could have sized down to an XS rather than the S I rented - I'm in between sizes and since there's so much fabric on the sides to enhance the flowy-ness, it does end up being a lot. If you're looking for a true tunic that you can wear day or night, this is the one for you.
Great to throw on with jeans. I found it to be a little bit full at the bottom but that worked for me.
I wish the top fit better. It droops a bit low. Otherwise, I would live in this dress.

links_reviews_title: Loved it so much... I bought it!
links_reviews_text: This dress is everything! I loved it so much, I decided to keep it. I am small chested and this was perfect for me- large chests mayyyy have trouble? But this dress is STUNNING!
Wore at New Years Eve back in south america and it was a huge hit.
This dress is beautiful. I unfortunately didn’t get a a chance to wear it in my vacation but tried it on and am completely obsessed.
I got this for dinner on my cruise. Very flattering. Lots of compliments.

links_reviews_title: Cute In Theory But Not Practical
links_reviews_text: I so wanted to love this dress but it was just weird. The way that the bust fits makes it feel like you're going to pop out at any minute but there is no way to wear a bra or cami or anything under it without it showing and looking absurd. Even if you were to make use of some dress tape to secure the girls, the fabric is so thin that there is nothing left to the imagination. So basically, in order to make it decent you need pasties and dress tape and I personally feel like that's too much work for a fun vacation dress.
Wore to a wedding and it was pretty perfect! Definitely needed heels for this one though.

links_reviews_title: Fun Dress but Not Great Fit
links_reviews_text: The shoulder straps were way too tight and didn't have much room to adjust them. It was easier to wear it not off the shoulders. I wore it to a date night with my boyfriend and he loved it but was a little uncomfortable in the shoulders
Wore it to a lake wedding. Super comfy and light and beautiful!

links_reviews_title: Pretty dress, snug around the shoulders
links_reviews_text: Really great for going out to a nice dinner in the summer. It was a bit tight around the shoulders but definitely still able to be worn comfortably. The material felt a bit stiff as it wasn't the softest but all in all very nice!

This dress has a unique hemline and is coated in a layer of ruffles that make the whole skirt's movements so fun! It hung lower on my chest than I expected, but you still get the cute off-the-shoulder style without the worry because the spaghetti straps keep it locked in place. 10/10

This dress is awesome! So fun to move around in, and would be perfect to wear for an occasion where dancing was involved. Given my build, I was fine with the bust area and the straps, but if you are broad shoulders or have a large bust I would consider sizing up or avoiding this style. So pretty!

links_reviews_title: Gorgeous but didn't work for me!
links_reviews_text: I thought this dress was so beautiful, but the neckline just didn't work for me. The straps were too wide for my shoulders (so were falling off), and the neckline was too low. You can't wear a normal bra with this. For the right body type though, this would be stunning!
The shoulders and bust were way too small so sadly I did not get to wear this beautiful dress. The fabric and colors were so pretty!
The dress is beautiful and the fabric is light. I usually wear XS and this is what I got. It was tight in the chest and arms. If I rent it again, I will try a Small :)

I really love this dress and am planning on wearing it to a bridal event next week. It's perfectly cut and the print and fabric are high quality. It can be dressed up for a more formal event or just worn with sandals for a casual outing. Super versatile and lovely piece!

Such a beautiful style of dress. The model makes it look gorgeous, however, in person it looks like a small tablecloth. I'm usually a small or medium in dresses. I went with a small, and while it fit my waist fine, my bust/chest was squeezed so tightly. The cut is very unflattering on chests. It's a shame I can't wear it this month.

Unfortunately this ran small and it did not fit me so I could not wear it all month :( In its defense, I am between an XS and a S so I went for the smaller when I probably should have gone bigger to be safe. A bummer because it is quite pretty!

links_reviews_title: Good for travel/beach/pool days but runs large
links_reviews_text: I wore this recently on a carribean vacation and it worked great for a beach coverup. I will say though that since I'm short, it ran super long on me. The fabric is pretty sheer but also cotton-y. Not something I would wear NOT on vacation.
I sized down which was good - it's quite billowy.
This was my trusty companion during copious amounts of lounging on a Cabo vacation. No faults found here! The print is fantastic and I enjoyed the little tassels. :]
Cute beach cover up!

I literally wore this as a beach cover up, a morning shawl, a night robe in this summer heat, and just over a crop top. Perfect all the time, so beautiful and colorful! Lowkey I may have to buy this...

I wore this to a birthday party and although the skirt itself is cute, the waistband is weirdly elastic and just not flattering. It didn’t sit right so whether I wore a shirt tucked or untucked it just hid my waistline that’s usually more hourglass.

I got this for new years and it was perfect. I am very tall, and this skirt would not work without opaque tights. Needs an underlayer because it's short. Gapped a little in back above butt, but it winter and I had a jacket. Recommend for a fun night out, easy to pair colors with.
This is one of those skirts you can dress up or down. I often wore it with a black turtleneck, black tights, and doc martins. It is so flattering and was short enough to be sexy, but decent.

links_reviews_title: I wanted to like this item
links_reviews_text: I was so optimistic about this skirt, and loved all the colors! Unfortunately, this item just fit extremely weird. It bunched at the waist, making the sequins poke out. This made the skirt have a very unflattering affect in my mid section.

The sequence was very messy and the skirt was made of stretchy material that you would have gotten at Limited Too in fourth grade. It was loose around the waist but tight around the stomach. Not flattering.

links_reviews_title: Perfect midi-mini - hits right where it should.
links_reviews_text: Wore it for NYE with a tighter black belly shirt and an oversized cardigan.

Should have gone with the tee-shirt dress that comes in this material! The material is great, but the skirt itself just isn't shaped the way a good mini should be. Because of the way the fabric is sewn into the waistband, it adds a lot of bulk and makes me look like I've got a pooch. It's fine with a big baggy sweater over it, but if you're looking to tuck anything into it, keep looking. Additionally, the back panel of the skirt doesn't have any shape or extra room built into it for a butt, so it rides up a LOT.
love The skirt but it was too big and long. I tried pulling it up, folding it over, it either wrinkled up or looked a mess lol. Runs large at the hips and length imo.
Even though this skirt didn’t fit me, I could appreciate how awesome it looks. I’m a size a medium/large, rented the large and it was just too big on me.

links_reviews_title: Cute - stretchy so you can size down!
links_reviews_text: This skirt is super cute. A lot of fun and can easily be dressed up or down. If you want it to be completely bodycon I would size down. I got it in my usual size (a small) and it was a little roomy but still very cute and wearable.
I rented this for a bachelorette party in Mexico and it was perfect! Wore it to dinner with a bunch of gold jewelry and it was a super easy look while looking put together. Fit pretty true to size.

Loved this! My favorite piece from the box. Wore it to a rehearsal dinner for a Florida wedding and then a few times for a trip to Puerto Rico. Didn’t wear a bra but you might be able to use a strapless bra. I have a narrow torso so it fit me built I could see anyone with a wider torso having a hard time zipping it. I loved it tho and got lots of compliments. The colors are bright and fun and the front part sort of moves around which I didn’t realize from the pictures.
The dress is cute on the picture but when i put it on, the bust area didnt fit at all and looked lopsided

links_reviews_title: I plant to wear it with a sweater and some boots this weekend and it will be great in the spring with a jean jacket and summer by itself!
links_reviews_text: Zipper is tight pulling up over rib and a little sticky. Might need help getting it up. Once up, okay!

links_reviews_title: So pretty, but be mindful of size!
links_reviews_text: I adore this dress! So pretty, but the medium is a bit baggy on my shoulders/ bust. I would def recommend sizing down if you're a bit smaller in that area- otherwise beautiful! I might try to rock it with a sweater on top :)
couldn’t zip it all the way up

I'm typically a large, but sized up to an XL to be safe. unforutunately it was way too loose around the bust - no security for the girls. Fit okay in the waist. I'd recommend going with your exact size, as this is probably pretty true to size. Waist is structured with a zipper but there's some elastic on the side without the zipper and around the bust part.

This is a great, funky dress for those with a long waist! If you're an hourglass with a shorter waist, it will puff up the hips and sit poorly. Also, better to be less-busty if you want to wear this piece.

links_reviews_title: Purchased within seconds of trying it on!
links_reviews_text: This dress is so unique and beautiful! I had to own it. I usually wear a small but the elastic on the side is forgiving so an extra small fit perfectly.
Fun dress but you can't wear a bra, it will be seen on the side with the cutout so I never got to wear it. Waist hung a little low too, it has elastic but wasn't tight.

links_reviews_title: Lovely material, just not quite right
links_reviews_text: I loved this dress in theory but it just didn't work for me. Being super flat chested, I was swimming in the bust area. The cut-out on the side looked much larger on me than in the photo (I'm 5'1, so I'm thinking the length of my waist had something to do with that). With that, there was just way too much material on top to work and be able to wear a bra with. I'll sadly send this back with no wears, but it will definitely look lovely on someone with the right proportions!

links_reviews_title: fierce but the tailoring is a little funny
links_reviews_text: I love the print on this skirt but the way that it ties over the tummy looks a little bunched. I feel like it makes it look like a cheaper design that it really is.
Sexy and comfort meet
The wrap on this skirt was cut at an angle that made it look like it was about to bust open.
This skirt is so cute on! When i saw it in my box, I wasn’t sure- but it’s SO cute on! Could be dressed up or down.
Skirt was extremely cute but ran way too small to actually zip it. It was basically up to rib cage before I could zip it closed. I’m typically small or xsmall so definitely size up.
this is a beautiful skirt - rent it!
Very cute but it does run small! Fabric is very soft and on trend

links_reviews_title: Love the print & fabric, but size up
links_reviews_text: A great skirt, perfect for work or going out. I would recommend sizing up as there is a zipper on the side.
Fits as expected

I could get this skirt to button at the top but it was too tight to wear outside. I normally wear a medium or large. In this I would need an XL. Also the faux wrap part was weirdly bunchy at the top? Not sure if it would be worth another attempt in a larger size.
I was super excited about this one, but the material was too itchy to wear
Too oversized in the waist for my frame size.
Pretty cropped and a little scratchy, bubble sleeves. I wore with high waisted jeans and it was really cute!
Cute sweater with sparkly threads running through it. The sleeves have a lot of volume, which my 22 year old daughter thought were too much - but I liked

Love the fabric, loved how fun it appeared and felt. It is more of a crop cut and I'm pretty busty so it made it even shorter for me, but with a basic undershirt and highwaisted pants it turned out to be pretty cute.
I got some many compliments and loved this sweater and the sleeves!
Super cute! And comfortable. I wore it with leggings and a tank underneath. I got lots of compliments.
Loved this sweater. A fun color with some shiny threads. Received lots of compliments. Wore it with a pair of light blue denim jeans.
I've learned that I like my sweaters long, and this is not long. The balloon sleeves are cute, though, IMO.
The sleeves are definitely a statement piece in the best way possible. The color is beautiful too. I wish the neckline was a bit higher, and the cut is somewhere in between cropped and hip length.

links_reviews_title: cute but cut too short for a long torso girl
links_reviews_text: I wanted to wear this so badly but it's just too short for me having a long torso fits great everywhere else
This was absolutely adorable but it did not work with my bump! I would have worn this all the time if not pregnant!
The sweater was lovely except for the large billowy sleeves. That's just my preference. I liked the way it looked with my jeans. Length in the body was fine. It was all about the sleeves.

This sweater was shorter than I normally wear, but I found out that it was good to get out of my comfort zone. I received so many compliments from random strangers as I strolled through the city in this comfy and cute sweater!
This looked terrible on me. The sleeves were huge and clownlike. I loved the color and pattern, but couldn't get over the sleeves.
I got a lot of compliments on this sweater. It's really cute on and fits well. It is a bit short so I wore it with high waisted jeans.
I love this sweater! The metallic thread is a nice touch and I got lots of compliments on it every time I wore it. It does hit just at the waist, which is a little shorter than most sweaters.
This sweater is so cute and comfortable. Loved the sleeves and the style of knit.
Cute with high waisted jeans. Definitely, short & boxy though. The material hangs well but it’s itchy and there’s a tag on the side that drove me crazy but wasn’t sure if I could remove it or not.

I loved the color of this and was so excited when I first saw it in my first nuuly box. The colors were cute, fun, and playful. HOWEVER, the sleeves were extremely awkward -- I didn't know how to make it look good with any of my outfits. i tried it on with SO many combinations of outfits to no avail. It wasn't a "cute" puffy sleeve, but more so an obnoxious one. Unfortunately, I wasn't able to wear this one at all :/
Too cropped and boxy for my taste. Tried doing a full tuck, but it kept falling out. Felt it was too boxy to not tuck in.
This sweater is super cute but short waisted. I wore it to a girls night out dinner with jeans.

I absolutely love the pattern of this sweater. Kinda grandma vibes, but I felt adorable in it. I wore it with leggings and jeans, and I felt like it really added to an outfit. Not a huge fan of bubble sleeves, because I felt a little like I was swimming in it even though it fit my torso, but I'm glad I tried it!

I love this sweater. It's unusual and understated. I wear with denim and love the ballooning on the sleeves and the metallic thread throughout. I have no problems with it itching, but I'm not surprised others did. Beware if that's normally an issue.

I liked this piece, but it was very itchy. I wore a long sleeve shirt underneath because I couldn't even stand to have it touch my arms. Buuuuut I still wore it twice. Also, it's sparkly, which I didn't notice in the pics.
This is a super cute sweater. I got a lot of compliments on it. I've actually never worn a sweater that I got so many compliments on. Bright, fun, and comfortable. I'm buying it!
It was more cropped than in the picture
This is very cute- but not at all insulated so if it’s chilly it won’t do the trick. Otherwise very stylish.

I wore this sweater a lot! It is a beautiful color and texture and was just the thing I went to grab when not wanting to work hard at putting an outfit together. It fit great and looks just like the photos. I will probably order this again.
So beautiful, got many compliments! nice pop of color

links_reviews_title: The perfect mix between a sweater and sweatshirt
links_reviews_text: I just received this yesterday and knew I needed to wear it immediately. It fits true to size and is incredibly comfortable - it feels like the perfect mix between a sweater and sweatshirt. I've also gotten a ton of compliments on it!
this top was too short + wide for me
Fits as expected. Oversized fit

links_reviews_title: so cute, but gives a fupa
links_reviews_text: love the style - unfortunately there are buttons/snaps at the top and not just a tie. It forms a little fupa area. wish it fit because it was so cute!
Very comfy but thinner material than I thought. Great length and hit at the waist just right.

I wanted to wear these for holiday parties and gatherings. They fit nicely but the fabric was not right for winter, would have been way too cold where I am. The color and pattern were unique. I wanted to make them work, but not sure if the polkadots were entirely my style.

It’s a lovely pair of pants and in such a fun and vibrant color! Just as my box arrived, the weather went from 60s to 20s and snowing in a day. I tried them on and loved the fit but didn’t get a chance to wear them because of the weather.

links_reviews_title: Obsessed with the print, not with the fit
links_reviews_text: The color and print of these pants are 100% my personal style brand. Unfortunately, the material of the pants made them look and fit oddly. It's a satin, very unstructured material which bunches up right in the tummy area. I wish they were more structured, and less like fancy pajamas. I did get a lot of compliments on them, though.

links_reviews_title: Cute! But bunches and gives you a pooch
links_reviews_text: I loved how quirky and fun these pants were, and they have a nice soft material to them. However, I am curvy and have thicker legs but a flat tummy and I noticed that the way they fit me made it tight on my legs/butt but loose on the front waist. It kind of made it look like I had a pooch stomach. I think if you have thinner legs and a flat stomach it would be perfect!
Really cute...fits like pajamas. I got the M and they were a bit baggy but still worked out fine!
Fits as expected. Size up for a more relaxed fit

Wore this in Mexico - put a denim jacket over it which made it much cuter. Otherwise it’s a pretty shapeless tent. I sized down from a S to an XS which was a good call but the way it just cuts across your chest doesn’t seem like it would be cute on anyone without something over it or unless it’s used as a cover up for a swimsuit.

Thought this dress would be an easy day dress on a beach vacation, which it was however it was super unflattering. I didn’t love the elastic band above the bust that seemed to accentuate the armpit area and make the fabric drape in a not cute way over the body. The bod of the dress is oversized which I expected.
Not very flattering - big all Over
Very comfortable summer dress! Looks even cuter with a denim jacket and some fun earrings!
Comfy and cute!
Dress just all around wasn’t a great fit. It was wayy too big in all areas and I couldn’t make it work.
Loved this dress online but it was too overpowering for my frame; so i knotted up the side, threw on some bright white sneaks and a denim jacket and made it work.

Perfect casual smart top that goes with many outfits. Pulling this out of the bag I was disappointed with the material and faded blue color (pic looks more vibrant) but once I tried it on I realized how great it really is. You can wear it with anything.
This is a beautiful color and a nice soft fabric. But it didn't do much for me cut-wise.
Nice for work
I like it! It's a very versatile top. The cut is easy to wear and it goes with everything. I was worried it would get super wrinkly while I wore it but that wasn't the case.
Versatile and easy to dress up/down.
Loved the fit!
The cut on this is not well done. This was tight in the arms and boob area- and huge everywhere else. not flattering at all.
If you love ruffles, then you'll love this top. It was a great everyday blouse that was easy to throw on with jeans. I wore it multiples times

links_reviews_title: Really tight in the chest area
links_reviews_text: This shirt was super tight around my chest and bunched up all day. Otherwise everything else about it was super cute and comfy. I would *strongly* recommend sizing up 2 whole sizes.
Slight restriction with your arm movement. The ruffles are VERY ruffle-ly. Overall so cute :)

I am usually an XS, but I read that this top might fit small so I got the S and it fit, but it wasn't super cute. Something about where the ruffles lay is in the middle of your breast so it's just not very flattering

The quality on this is great, and I received a ton of compliments the day I wore it, but it was definitely difficult to style. I had to play around with a ton of my bottoms to find something that wouldn't clash with the style of the top, but that may be a symptom of this being a little frillier than my comfort zone. Super cute and happy I rented, but definitely not the easiest to make work.
Strange fit and pleated areas are very big and stick out
The shirt was too puffy and it did not lay well on my chest. Overall, too much material.

Loved this top! I wore it three times during my rental period. I thought it was super flattering and honestly regret not buying it. Thought the fit was perfect for my size. Worked well tucked in or not tucked in for jeans and skirts.
This is such a great piece. I’m pairing it with the plaid Anthro pants and it looks so cute. Love this blouse!
Couldn’t wear this because the arms were way too tight. Cute blouse but the arms made it unwearable. Ordered my normal size Medium.

links_reviews_title: Loved the Eyelet Detail and Tiered Sleeves!
links_reviews_text: This is an all-around great blouse! It's simple enough to wear with anything but the fun sleeves and eyelet detail make it extra special. Despite the boxy fit and longer sleeves it's such a lightweight material so you won't mind wearing it in the summer. I could have sized up and been happy just because the back and armpits were pretty snug.
Easy and fun. Fit well and wasn’t too much fabric/ruffle

I received so many compliments on this dress! It’s absolutely beautiful. I got the x-small and found that it is true to size. I agree with other comments that it isn’t truly off-the-shoulder (you kind of have to force it down on your shoulders if you want to wear it that way). Nonetheless, it still looks pretty when it’s not worn off-the-shoulder.

I really wanted to like this dress but the elastic off-the-shoulder part is way too small and I ended up not wearing it :/ I even tried going two sizes larger than what I normally wear since this is a common issue for off-the-shoulder garments. Totaly shame because the fabric and length are great to wear to work! Dang!

This dress really is adorable. Although I normally wear a S/M, I ordered an XS. This dress is easy to wear and comfy. I felt that it was still a bit long on me even though I ordered the petite.

I am OBSESSED with this dress. It hugs my curves perfectly and covers up areas I'm not as thrilled about. It's got pockets, and though some folks have complained that it's too heavy, I like the structure and the fact that the skirt is flouncy but doesn't get blown up by the wind! Keeping for sure. Based on other reviews, I sized up from my usual 16 to an 18W and it was perfect.

Two stars for quality & being a well-made dress; however, this dress was really unflattering on my curvy/athletic body. It looked dowdy! The dress is lined, which might be great for an event, but not ideal as a relaxed-vacation dress (which it looks like in photos). Unfortunately didn’t wear this one at all. I have a small torso and medium bust size and it was tight but fit—this would be too small on a large bust!
Love the fit of this dress but it is very long as other reviewers described. It looked best when i knotted it up on side and wore with white sneakers.
Great fit but definitely long. I’m short but wedges made it work. The shirt dress was fun and retro but the print was pure summer magic. It’s bright and attention grabbing!

links_reviews_title: This is precisely the kind of thing you rent
links_reviews_text: Loved this dress! Super fun piece to rent and wear a couple times. I think the loud orange and white floral print that might drown some women worked beautifully on my six-foot frame. Got compliments both times I wore it to the office and to a work event with teal cut-out derby shoes. Loved the pockets. The chest definitely gapes. The first time I wore a white cami and the second time I didn't so my bright green bra was probably playing peek-a-boo a bit... oops. Great quality material again. Very pleased.

This dress is casual but cute! The waist tucks nicely so it’s flattering. It’s light enough for the hot days and the color is awesome. Just like other reviews suggested I sized up one from my usual 6 to an 8 and it fit perfectly.

I loved this dress. Was so glad to get it in time for the end of summer. While I was out getting coffee, two strangers came up raving about this dress. I needed a camisole because I wore it to work. The fabric was heavy for the hottest days of summer, but it was perfect for a hot, post-Labor day dress. And...pockets!
Dress is very comfortable! Summery print is adorable and fit is flattering too. If I were to buy it, I’d add some sort of pin at the chest to prevent it from popping open.
Love the dress, will order again, but will size up. Bust area was snug!
wanted to love this too...but it was too tight in the ribcage area

links_reviews_title: Quality Resort dress for day or evening!
links_reviews_text: I love this dress! I think it is a linen/cotton blend, so yes, it does have weight to it. The length was closer to maxi on my average frame with curves. The waist line was slimming at slightly higher line. There are pockets! I wore all day swapping out sandals and sneakers.
I like this dress a lot, but the bust is a little tight for me.

links_reviews_title: Cute but heavy for the Season
links_reviews_text: I had to tack the bust closed as the neckline fell lower on me than on the model. I assume this was because of my bust size and height. Also, this material was a bit heavy for summer (July), but other than that I really liked this dress. The color is great and the print scale is beautiful. i am 5'3" and the dress fell longer on me than on the model, of course. The dresses is nicely lined and I really liked the cottony materiel. Was a very easy outfit - I love to throw on a dress and go.

links_reviews_title: This dress found its forever home!
links_reviews_text: A 'cuspy' 8/10 i may need to size up. I'm smaller up top and a 'cuspy' 6/8 - the 8 fits like a glove, but might not be as forgiving on a larger bust. I'm larger across the ribs as well and broad shouldered and the fit is perfect. Will be keeping this one as I can think of a million ways to style, but today just threw on denim checkered Vans and hit the streets.
I didn’t realize it had pockets!! I was so pumped. It did end up being a little more A-line then it appeared online.

links_reviews_title: I sized up two sizes (like reviews encouraged) and still couldn't fit into this dress.
links_reviews_text: :( It was so narrow that I couldn't button it across my chest or hips. Seems like it would be a cute piece, but unfortunately, I didn't get to enjoy it.

Size up maybe 2

links_reviews_title: Runs small. Sad because it’s gorgeous!

I was able to get away with wearing a minimizing bra and using one safety pin to hold the bust area closed at the button. This item went on clearance at Anthro and I snagged it, sizing up to a 6. Unfortunately the armpits are now gaping and you can see way too much of my bra. I will have to get it altered, but totally worth it.
Well-tailored shirtdress with quality material. A little tight in the bust.

links_reviews_title: Loved everything about this dress! So flattering
links_reviews_text: This dress was perfect for summer days! I loved that it had pockets and it was super flattering on. The belt in the middle really helped cinch it in so it wasn't too shapeless. I also found the length to be perfect. I often have a hard time with dresses being too short.

It wasn't 100% perfection for me, but it's a step above most shirt dresses. It had more structure than the typical shirt dress & the skirt have a little movement and swing. My torso's on the longer side so the tie waist didn't hit me at the right spot, but it was still looked nice. (tie waist is attached to the dress which I think looks nicer, but is less adjustable.) I think it'd be a great option for most.
It was super cute!! I wish it fit me

This dress is absolutely gorgeous, I wish I could have worn it! I'm almost always an 8 in Anthro dresses, but this one ran too small through the chest on me. I would definitely recommend ordering up a size, but it is a beautiful dress, well lined and such a nice fabric...perfect for work or a weekend brunch.

I loved this dress! I got it specifically for a trip to NYC, and it was perfect for what I wanted. My only comment is that the button on the bust kept popping open throughout the day, so it was something I was constantly checking, but a size up would have been too big.
Slightly shorter on me than the pic and the material was heavy. It was cute though and I wore it a few times.

Loved this dress but it ran small in bust and waist. I got a petite and think that the regular size would have fit well. I did wear it and got a lot of compliments. I would consider buying this but in different size.

My online complaint was that it ran a little small and where it hit on my waist wasn’t super comfortable. I would have been better going a size up I think. Overall it was really cute and I probably would have bought it if i went with the medium instead!

links_reviews_title: Adorable top with eye catching back
links_reviews_text: I love this top. I wore it out for a friend's birthday at a bar with the free people Lita Slim Leg Jean, a black cross body bag, and free people velvet cheetah print booties. Got compliments on it! It fits well, even for someone with a larger chest.

This is a sexy top with the strappy back and red color. It also shows some skin from the front since it’s slightly cropped. (The straps in the back were longer than expected.) I styled them with black legging-fit ankle pants of the same material and black high heel booties.
I loved this top. It's simple but the sleeves really make it special. Definitely got a lot of compliments on it. Tightening up the back took some time and finesse, but eventually I got it.

I didn’t think I would wear this top because I struggled with what to put on underneath since it’s backless. However, I actually really like it now that I have it on since the front has a nice structured fit. I do think it runs a tab bit small. I put a bralette underneath with a lacy back since this is a backless shirt.

Fit just as expected, and was comfortable too! My only note to renters would be that it wears at a semi-crop length, not really a full length blouse but not a crop top either. I bought this item I loved it so much :)
THE MOST ADORABLE PEASANT TOP EVER! Super flattering on the waist, the back detailing, everything about this shirt is flawless!
Was too big and was very structured and didn't flow like I wanted it to
Super cute dress with a great fit.
I think I got a defective one maybe? Mine had stitching that kept pulling to the side and led to a really unflattering lumpy silhouette. It otherwise fit great.
This dress was adorable. It fit very nicely to my body, but I just couldn't find anywhere to wear it. It is too cold where I am to wear without stockings, which I didn't want to do. Loved it though.

Unfortunately the dress didn't fit me. Based on other reviews, I opted for the Medium - and I could barely get it zipped at all. Way too small in the chest/bust area. Dress is so pretty though. Material is stiff and has NO give or stretch. If you're between two sizes, I'd size up!
sizing was off - made my mid section look large
This dress seems effortless and easy to wear but the fit was really weird and the fabric would bunch up where the zipper is. Would not recommend

links_reviews_title: Zipper puckered weirdly on the side
links_reviews_text: Really cute dress but bizarre zipper puckering happening on the side

links_reviews_title: Adored this dress. Straps were a little stretched, though!
links_reviews_text: Some midis don't work well on petite girls but this one was absolutely an exception. It looks great with a jean jacket, a t-shirt beneath, with vans, sandals, or heels. The tough part about this dress is that it seems like someone who had a bigger bust than me wore it before - it was stretched in the spaghetti straps so I had to be mindful of the straps constantly falling down when I sat.

links_reviews_title: Easy to pack for vacation (no wrinkles)
links_reviews_text: I brought this dress with me on a few weekend trips - it was super easy to pack and came out of my suitcase with zero wrinkles. The only downside for me was that the zipper bunched up a tad creating a small bump on my hip, but I don't think anyone really noticed but me.
I would usually never wear a size large, but this dress in large was so tight around the hips I almost couldn’t get it on. I am pear-shaped, wear a 28 in denim and small or medium top.

links_reviews_title: Was so cute but ran small
links_reviews_text: I should have ordered a large. Medium was great on top but tight on the hips and would ride up when I walked. I loved the cowl neckline!

I do love the shape and pattern of this dress, but as another review states, the zipper area was lumpy and it caused the fabric to bunch up. The cowl was a little low for me and the armpits were weird. Maybe just not for my body type.
This dress was so cute but it was really lumpy and bunched up on the side where the zipper was on the side so i just couldn't wear it :(

I decided to keep this dress because I think it has a lot of potential with getting dressed up and down for brunch, a casual night out or even a cocktail event. It was a little large right under my underarm area, which I think I will get tailored but otherwise, I think it's a really flattering dress. I'm not curvy at all, but I feel like it gives me slight shape.

I wore this on an anniversary dinner date with heels and then a few days later with vans and a tshirt underneath. I am quite large up top and the zipper was just a little snug but held the girls together nicely! The straps are not adjustable. Loved!

links_reviews_title: Runs a bit small, but it's cute!
links_reviews_text: I'm normally a medium, but read the reviews and sized up to a large. The large fit well for the most part. Wasn't too tight or too loose in the stomach and butt area, and the non-adjustable straps stay in place. I'm smaller chested, so sizing up made the cowl neck a bit tooooo wide in the front and I'd feel uncomfortable wearing it with just a bra underneath -but it looks super cute with a t shirt layered underneath like the model!

links_reviews_title: Wish the Sizing wasn't so wild
links_reviews_text: Love the material/fabric, it's a gingham with an overlay of polkadots - super cute. Unfortunately, I couldn't even zip up the side zipper. I'm usually a 10/12 in dresses and D cup. I should have known with the sizing being S/M/L, but I took a chance. Would be super cute on a less curvy frame though!

Fits as expected.

links_reviews_title: Size up if you have curves!
links_reviews_text: I'm 5'4" and 110 lbs, I got my normal size of XS this did not work with my curves. There is NO stretch to the fabric. I'm a 32D and it was very tight in the bust and at my hips, so I unfortunately won't be wearing this piece. Definitely size up if you have curves.

I'm calling this dress true to size, but if you want it to fit as shown in the product image (looser, with a tee underneath), definitely size up. For me, the small fit like a glove and was very form fitting, making the dress feel more formal. It is super pretty and great for a night out, but definitely adjust sizing based on what look you want to achieve. Also noticed the bunching that the other reviews mentioned, which I assumed would go away if sizing for a more baggy fit. All around this dress is super versatile and could be worn in so many different situations!

This is the perfect dress-up or dress-down midi that works for any occasion! I wore it to work with a jacket and sneakers then later on to a concert outside. It could easily be elevated with heels for something fancier! The sides of the dress at the hip tend to get a little bunchy but nothing too drastic.

Fits like a glove! I love the slits in the side. I'm not super curvy so the fabric bunches a bit at the seams around the hips. Super easy to dress it up or down without having to think too hard about it. I layer it with a tshirt and pair it with sneakers or platform sandals for day/work and ditch the tshirt and throw on some jewelry and mules or strappy sandals for night!
unfortunately too tight around the booty

The material was very thin and it has a liner for the bottom but it’s like a two inch inseam pair of shorts that you can see through the material.

fit great and super nice for transitioning from winter to spring in feb! wore casually and to work :)

Either the top was just too big for me or I couldn’t figure out how to tie it up correctly. Never wore it.
